header.title: Chasing The Dragon: The Magick of Le Veritable Dragon Noir

central_thesis: This work presents a revised methodology for engaging with the spirits of the grimoire 'Le Veritable Dragon Noir' (referred to as The Black Dragon), moving away from traditional Solomonic methods of forceful command and intimidation towards a respectful, invitational approach based on personal magical revelation and the understanding of these entities as 'elders in creation' rather than 'demons' to be chastened.

structure_content.summary: The author explains how this work serves as a supplement to his previous book 'Crossed Keys', detailing the genesis of his revised approach to The Black Dragon. He recounts a 'eureka moment' during an evocation of Frimost, where the spirit challenged the traditional Solomonic methods of commanding and threatening, leading the author to develop a more respectful and invitational system aligned with his personal beliefs and practice.

This section outlines a three-day preparatory period for the full rite. It includes a progressive fast, daily meditation sessions (3x30 minutes), making offerings to patron deities or the Holy Guardian Angel, physical cleaning and setup of the temple and magical circle (e.g., using Natron), and a magical cleansing of the temple in a suitable planetary hour.

Describes the initial Sunday ritual to evoke the 4 Kings of the Cardinal Directions (Magoa for East, Amaymon for North, Bayemon for West, Egym for South). Preparations involve meditation, a ritual bath, anointing, and donning clean garments. The core practice involves a powerful visualization of self-empowerment (drawing energy from sky and earth), followed by specific, revised conjurations for each King while lighting incense at their respective directional points within the circle.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Evocation of Each Day's Ruler
structure_content.summary: Provides the detailed working for Monday's ruler, Lucifer, as an example for the subsequent daily evocations. The method maintains the same preliminary rites as the Kings' evocation. The altar is set with Lucifer's seal, a candle, and incense. The evocation involves a specific invitational conjuration addressing Lucifer by name and invoking the authority of the Cardinal Kings, culminating with a specific calling phrase.

The author reiterates his intent: to demonstrate a methodology for adapting grimoire rites and to encourage readers to experiment and create their own adaptations of ancient texts, rather than rigidly adhering to existing methods. He suggests that Grimoiric Magick may have been practiced in varied ways even in its original period.

Provides clarifications and additional context for certain statements and practices mentioned in the main text, including sourcing materials, the deeper meaning of certain ritual phrases, and the author's approach to seals and calls.

key_concepts.term: Le Veritable Dragon Noir (The Black Dragon)
key_concepts.definition: The grimoire whose magical system and spirits are the subject of the author's adaptations and workings. The author clarifies his previous work on 'The Black Dragon' in 'Crossed Keys'.

The author's modified evocational texts that replace traditional commanding and threatening language with respectful invitations, acknowledging spirits as powerful elders and offering blood in exchange for their aid, as revealed by Frimost.
The author's prior publication (Scarlet Imprint, 2011) that introduced translations of grimoires and his initial work with The Black Dragon, upon which this supplement builds.

The foundational ritual involving the respectful summoning of the four Cardinal Kings of the Directions (Magoa, Amaymon, Bayemon, Egym) on Sunday, establishing their blessing and authority for the subsequent workings.
The sequence of rituals performed on successive days (e.g., Lucifer for Monday) to evoke specific spirits, drawing upon the authority granted by the previously evoked Cardinal Kings.
The culminating rite of the complete working, where the 11 spirits adorning the Black Dragon's pages are called upon together, signifying a deeper engagement or personal transformation for the Magus.

A three-day preparatory dietary regimen, beginning with whole foods and gradually restricting intake to fruits, vegetables, and pure water, culminating in a 24-hour water-only fast before the main rite.
A command spoken three times thrice to 'part the gates of hell', used during the self-empowerment phase of the King's evocation.

practical_system.description: The practical system is an adapted, initiatory working with the spirits of 'Le Veritable Dragon Noir', emphasizing respect and invitation over coercion. It is structured into a multi-day process beginning with extensive preparation and culminating in an 'initiation'. The core principle is a personalized and experientially derived approach to spirit contact, aiming for partnership and blessings rather than forced servitude.
tools: Magical circle (single line, potentially adorned, e.g., with homemade Natron)
Candles (for directional points, altar, appropriate colors)
Abramelin Oil or High John The Conqueror oil (for anointing)
Seal of the Spirit being evoked (placed on altar)
Book: 'The Black Dragon' (Le Veritable Dragon Noir)
Florida Water / 'Holy Water' / Nile River water (for physical cleansing)
Materials for offerings (blood implied for spirit exchange, fumigation explicit)
rituals: 3-Day Preparatory Period (progressive fast, 3x daily 30-min meditations, offerings to patrons/HGA, physical temple cleansing with Florida Water/Nile Water, magical cleansing of temple).

The First Evocation, The Kings (Sunday: ritual bath, anointing with Abramelin Oil/High John The Conqueror, self-empowerment visualization 'Lightning Strike' and 'Fire of Fire', intoning 'Zazas Zazas Nasatanada Zazas!' thrice, followed by specific invitational conjurations for King Magoa, King Amaymon, King Bayemon, and King Egym, circling counter-clockwise).

The Evocation of Each Day's Ruler (Monday-Sunday: repetition of preliminary rites, altar setup with the specific spirit's seal, candle, and incense, followed by specific invitational conjurations for the day's ruler, e.g., Lucifer for Monday, including phrases like 'Renich Tasa Uberaca Biasa Icar Lucifer!').
Culminating 'Initiation' Rite (Calling all 11 spirits of The Black Dragon together for a final ceremony, details not fully elaborated but implied as the completion of the cycle).

relevant_quotes.text: Why would any but the named come when the invitation to eat at your table was so replete with threats and intimidation? And why, if your intent is to ask of me a gift, would you deem it acceptable and wise to promise to torment me day after day should I not agree? I come not out of fear nor out of obligation, for over me no man has power. I come because you think to give me blood in exchange for what you seek, and that I would have.

The Black Dragon's power lies not in the conjurations provided therein â€“ those are a blind intended, as stated, to give the work an air of piety. The power of the Black Dragon is in the structure in which it is presented

I conjure and evoke you, O Powerful Magoa, King of the East and Ruler of Air, that thou mayest hear me and attend me this nite! Great Magoa, under whom serve Masseyel, Asiel, Satiel, Arduel, Acorib and countless others, hear thou me and grant me an audience! Accept this offering of fumigation, and by my will make it take the shape of that which is most pleasing unto thee, and look upon me this night with favor, granting unto me your blessings in this endeavor!
Renich Tasa Uberaca Biasa Icar Lucifer! (9x)

critical_analysis.relevance: This work is highly relevant for contemporary practitioners of ceremonial magic and grimoire traditions. It addresses a common dilemma in modern occultism: how to ethically and effectively interact with entities traditionally commanded or threatened in grimoires. By offering a revised, respectful, and invitational methodology, Cecchetelli provides a viable alternative that aligns with personal gnosis and avoids religious hypocrisy. Its focus on adapting ancient texts rather than strict adherence makes it a valuable contribution to the ongoing evolution of magical practice.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary target audience consists of experienced occultists, practitioners of grimoire magic, and those with a background in Western Esotericism. It is particularly suited for magicians familiar with traditional Solomonic methods who are seeking to evolve their practice or who are directly working with 'Le Veritable Dragon Noir'. The text assumes a certain level of prior magical knowledge and comfort with ritual work, including temple setup, banishing rites, and spirit evocation.
